groups.name: Things You See in the Sky

easy.notes: Easy puzzle: each group has four items that share a simple theme. Near-miss temptation example: 'bee' could be mistaken with 'wasp' if included, but 'wasp' is not used to keep simple. Group themes: stripes (animals with stripes or striped items), pairs (things worn or used in couples), sky objects (observed in day sky), and sounds (objects that produce sound commonly used to signal).

medium.notes: Medium puzzle: each group has a distinct relationship. Near-miss temptation: 'pencil' could seem like a writing tool rather than a hand tool; clarified that 'pencil' is included in the 'Tools You Use with Hands' due to its common manual use. Prefix group is about words that begin with 're-'. Prefix/compound word parts help reasoning. Ensure items clearly fit only one group.

hard.notes: Hard puzzle: more abstract groupings and two-step reasoning. Near-miss temptation: 'sunset' might be seen as time of day rather than color-object combo; clarified as color+object word pairings. Syllable-count group ensures each item has two syllables. MODE group includes items each representing a transport mode. Plant parts group is straightforward; ensure no overlap with other groups.
